name: Yarn
description: A cheat sheet for the yarn package manager

Working with a project.val: Initializes a new project and create the package.json file.
Creates a globally-installed symbolic link from the current project's folder.
Publish a package to the npm registry.
Adds the <user> as an owner of <package>. You must be an owner of <package> in order to run this command.
Removes the <user> from the list of owners of <package>. You must be an owner of <package> in order to run this command.
Creates a compressed gzip archive of the project's dependencies.
Starts an interactive session to update the project version.

Working with project dependencies.val: Install the <package> from the npm registry and save it to the project's package.json dependencies.
Install the <package> from the npm registry and save it to the project's package.json devDependencies.
Removes the <package> from the node_module folder as well as the project's package.json.
Upgrades all the dependecies in the project's package.json.
Check the npm registry for any installed packages that are outdated.
Creates a yarn.lock in the project's folder, describing all the project's dependencies.
Lists all the licenses for all your dependecies listed in package.json.
Automatically generate the license disclaimer based on all the licenses for all your dependencies listed in package.json.
Verifies that the versions of the package dependencies in the project's package.json match those in yarn's lock file.
Free up space by removing unnecessary files and folders from node_modules. It generates a .yarnclean file.
Retrieves information about <package> in a tree format.

Working with project tasks.val: Runs the start script if provided in the project's package.json.
Runs the test script if provided in the project's package.json.
Runs the <task> script if provided in the project's package.json.

Global tasks.val: Print the folder where yarn will install executable files for your package.
Retrieves the value of <key> from config.
Install the <package> from the npm registry globally instead of the project's package.json file.
Show the data in the yarn cache.
Delete the data from the cache folder.
Updates yarn to the latest version.

NPM equivalents.val: These are all exact equivalents of init/link/publish/run/outdated/cache clean/login/start/test
